decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal, and card advantage to outvalue the opponent. The deck includes cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils to generate card advantage and prevent the opponent from effectively interacting with your game plan. March of Otherworldly Light can provide a win condition by creating a board presence while No More Lies and Get Lost can disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to control the game until it can close out with powerful finishers like Elspeth, Storm Slayer.

This deck is focused on combining the cards Retraction Helix and creatures like Cori-Steel Cutter and Rona, Herald of Invasion to generate infinite loops and create a powerful board state. By utilizing cards like Sleight of Hand, Opt, and Consider to dig for key pieces, and protection spells like Spell Pierce, the deck aims to set up a winning combo quickly against opponents. With Mox Amber and Mox Jasper providing ramp and additional mana sources, this deck is designed to be fast-paced and overwhelming for the opponent.

The deck revolves around using Lotus Field to generate a large amount of mana quickly, while utilizing cards like Hidden Strings and Vizier of Tumbling Sands to untap it for additional mana. The goal is to ramp up to powerful spells like Emergent Ultimatum and Omniscience, enabling explosive plays and overwhelming the opponent. The deck also includes control elements like Languish and Bala Ged Recovery to manage the board and recover key cards. Overall, the strategy is to assemble the combo pieces efficiently and overpower the opponent with big plays.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive plays to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes powerful creatures like Sheoldred and Kroxa, supported by instant removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrade to clear the way for attacks. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Duress and Thoughtseize to disrupt opponent's strategy, while also providing consistency with lands that can produce both red and black mana. The deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

This aggro deck focuses on ramping up mana with green devotion creatures and using powerful green spells like Storm the Festival and Cavalier of Thorns to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Llanowar Elves and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx, the deck aims to efficiently cast big threats like Old-Growth Troll and Ulvenwald Oddity early in the game. The inclusion of Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner and Oath of Nissa help with card advantage and filtering, while Lair of the Hydra and Boseiju, Who Endures provide additional utility and protection.

This Dimir Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize, while also having a mix of aggressive creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Floodpits Drowner to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with threats on the opponent's side of the board. With a combination of disruptive spells and aggressive creatures, this deck aims to control the game and close out matches quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures and efficient burn spells. The key strategy is to maintain constant pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger, while using cards like Reckless Rage and Burst Lightning to remove any threats they may play. The mana base is optimized for quick, consistent plays, allowing the deck to quickly establish dominance on the battlefield and secure a fast victory.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggression and disruption, utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Duress to disrupt opponents' strategies while quickly deploying threats like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to apply pressure. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with opposing creatures. With a combination of hand disruption, removal, and powerful threats, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents and secure a victory.

The main objective of this Dimir Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with a mix of hand disruption like Thoughtseize and aggressive creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Cecil, Dark Knight. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and apply pressure with evasive creatures like Faerie Miscreant and Spyglass Siren. The inclusion of cards like Enduring Curiosity and Nowhere to Run provides additional value and tempo advantage. With a focus on tempo and disruption, this deck aims to outpace and overwhelm the opponent in a quick and efficient manner.

The main idea behind this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly build up a board presence with efficient creatures like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic, while disrupting opponents with Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria. Collected Company helps dig for more threats while Skyclave Apparition deals with opposing creatures. The deck also includes some versatile creatures like Knight of Autumn and Werefox Bodyguard, along with some lands that provide additional utility. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive game plan while still having answers to their threats.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with small, efficient creatures that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Adeline, Resplendent Cathar, the deck aims to quickly grow its army of creatures and put pressure on the opponent. Cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben help to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while Warden of the Inner Sky and Declaration in Stone provide removal options. The deck also includes a mix of protection cards like Dauntless Bodyguard and extraction abilities with cards like Extraction Specialist.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells. By continuously applying pressure through fast creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger, while using burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to clear the way or finish off the opponent, this deck aims to close out the game quickly. Additionally, cards like Kumano, Faces Kakkazan and Cori-Steel Cutter provide additional sources of damage or removal to help secure the win. The key strategy is to maintain a fast and aggressive pace to overpower the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and direct damage spells to quickly reduce their life total to zero. It focuses on putting pressure on the opponent early in the game with efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, while also using burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to clear the way and finish off the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Kumano, Faces Kakkazan and Heroes' Hangout to provide additional threats and ways to deal damage. Finally, the mana base is designed to ensure a consistent and fast mana curve.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to utilize a combination of counter spells, removal spells, and planeswalkers to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By using cards like Dovin's Veto and Supreme Verdict, along with planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils, the deck aims to maintain board control and generate card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Get Lost and Consult the Star Charts also provide options for disruption and card advantage, allowing the player to outmaneuver their opponent and secure a victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly equipping your creatures with powerful artifacts like Colossus Hammer to deal massive damage to your opponent as quickly as possible. With cards like Sigarda's Aid and Nahiri, Heir of the Ancients, you can ensure your creatures are always equipped and ready for battle. The deck also features cards like Portable Hole and Shadowspear to deal with your opponent's threats, while Cloud, Midgar Mercenary and Kemba, Kha Enduring provide additional support and aggression on the battlefield. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with efficient and aggressive creatures equipped with powerful artifacts.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining card advantage through card draw and manipulation. It features a Companion, Kaheera, the Orphanguard, for additional synergy. The deck includes a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and board wipes to control the game. It also includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils to provide card advantage and board presence. The goal is to outvalue the opponent and control the game until victory can be achieved.
